properties.name: 's-Hertogenbosch
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Home town of Jetse de Vries, editor of the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: A Tiny off the Coast of the Philippines
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The island of last resort for Roy Parekh -- as told in Jason Stoddard\'s "Overhead" -- where he hides, while still being in touch enough to keep Intelligent Risk (and it\'s continued Moon missions) running as long as possible...

properties.name: Administrator's Quonset Hut Offices
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The Administrators\' Quonset Hut Offices on Little Yunhe Square where Yuen\'s brother Xiaohao made his first, rather futile, presentation, as told in "The Earth of Yunhe". Will he and Yuen be more successful a seond time?

properties.name: Asia, Hong Kong
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine New flu vaccines -- released through the Spanish consultancy Pensamiento Aplicado -- effective against the highly contagious bird flu virus, as narrated in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Bay of Bengal
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine At the Bay of Bengal; wind towers, reforestation and tidal control has reduced flooding, soil erosion and the number of cyclone landfalls, in a co-ordinated defence implemented by the Spanish consultation firm Penasamiento Aplicado -- as told in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" by Gareth Lyn Powell & Aliette de Bodard in the SHINE anthology

properties.name: Bilbao
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine

properties.name: Bilbao
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Bilbao: the city where Lisa and Stéphane sail to in search for a better (and very uncertain) future, as narrated in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Boubara
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Boubara, where the village woman pound manioc and palm nuts. Until they find a more \'sustainable\' way of doing it in "Sustainable Development", as told by Paula R. Stiles...

properties.name: Bristol
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Gareth Lyn Powell, co-author of "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" from the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: City Park Wilderness
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Pockets of wilderness (from abandoned city parks, left to flourish or die) that are now being reclaimed in a future, unnamed North American city -- that went from continental wealth to continental poverty -- and is, ever so gradually, adapting to new circumstances, as narrated in "Summer Ice"...

properties.name: Drought-resistant wheat in Sub-Saharan Africa
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Pensamiento Aplicado’s initial success: the implementation of drought-resistant wheat in Subsaharan Africa, as told in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" by Gareth Lyn Powell & Aliette de Bodard in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Eric Gregory
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Home town of SHINE anthology writer -- of "The Earth of Yunhe" -- Eric Gregory.

properties.name: Holly Phillips
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Victoria, home town of Holly Phillips, author of "Summer Ice": a story in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Home Town of Jacques Barcia
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Jacques Barcia: SHINE author of "The Greenman Watches the Black Bar Go Up, Up, Up"!

properties.name: Ice Sculpture
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine An ice sculpture made by Manon in the freezer of a befriended ice cream shop -- as told in "Summer Ice" -- now displayed in the park of an unnamed North American city (which went from \'continental wealth to continental poverty\') as an ethereal signpost marking the transition between worlds.

properties.name: Island with intelligent coral
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine A small island near Vanua Lava surrounded with intelligent coral, grown for organic computing, as told in "The Solnet Ascendancy".

properties.name: Jason Stoddard
properties.description: Posted by DaybreakmagazineSanta Clarita: home town of SHINE author Jason Stoddard, who wrote "Overhead". Excerpt of the story in the link!

properties.name: Little Wuxi
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Little Wuxie, where Yuen -- the main character from "The Earth of Yunhe" -- repairs one of the waether accumulators in a future China.

properties.name: North End of Napa
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine

properties.name: Paradise Springs Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by DaybreakmagazineThe (future?) Paradise Springs Golf Course where Roy Parekh -- one of the main characters in "Overhead" -- makes the deal with Thom Lymann to set up the FOLR (Fund of Last Resort), which will eventually finance the Moonbase.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Paris: home town of Aliette de Bodard, co-author of "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Patient Whale
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The vessel where Xiaohao -- Yuen\'s brother in "The Earth of Yunhe"-- is kept imprisoned after he unleashed his crazy ideas from Ecclesia, meant to restore Yunhe\'s environment from the ground up...

properties.name: Paula R. Stiles
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Vancouver: home town of Paula R. Stiles, author of "Sustainable Development" from the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Place de la Nation
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Place de la Nation: where Lisa met up with Stéphane during a protest march, as narrated in "The Church of Acclerated Redemption" by Gareth Lyn Powll & Aliette de Bodard.

properties.name: Préfecture de Paris
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Via the Paris\'Préfacture website Lisa -- the main character from "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" -- finds out where the strange manin the Bedouin scarf she saw across, indeed, the Church of Accelerated Redemption, might show up again...

properties.name: São José’s Market
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The \'Black Market\' square where Inácio finds out more about a company called Gear5 -- who are using up huge amounts of carbon credits -- in "The Greenman Watches the Black Bar Go Up, Up, Up.

properties.name: Tel Aviv
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Lavie Tidhar, author of "The Solnet Ascendancy", who is originally from Israel, but has moved around the world (South Africa, the UK, Vanuatu and Laos at the last count).

properties.name: The Market House on Sola
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The Market House in Sola, Vanua Lava, where Fatfat Freddy and Mike Rowe initiate the chain of events leading to "The Solnet Ascendancy", after Freddie\'s seemingly innocuous remark: "I want email." (As narrated in the same titled story in the SHINE anthology).

properties.name: The Wall barring the Sea
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine "HE LOVED THE wall barring the sea. It was his best kept secret, or else he believed it was. Inácio never told it to anyone." The opening sentences of "The Greenman Watches the Black Bar Go Up, Up, Up".
